feed.title: Google Cloud: Filestore
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Filestore

entry.content: The [promoteReplica API](https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.locations.instances/promoteReplica) is available for promoting replicas to regular instances. For more information, see [About instance replication](https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/instance-replication).
entry.summary: The promoteReplica API is now available to promote replicas to regular instances. This feature enhances instance management by allowing replicas to be promoted.
entry.title: Feature: New API available for replica promotion

entry.content: You can now use the [Filestore CSI driver](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/persistent-volumes/filestore-csi-driver) to create Filestore instances with the NFSv4.1 protocol from the Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) cluster. This feature is available for zonal, regional, and enterprise [service tiers](https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/service-tiers).
entry.summary: You can now create Filestore instances using the Filestore CSI driver on GKE. This supports NFSv4.1 protocol and is available across various service tiers, including zonal, regional, and enterprise.
entry.title: Feature: Filestore CSI driver available on GKE
